Posts.Content: I don't know what HER2 IS CAN SOMEONE GIVE SOME INFO PLEASE.     THANKS
Posts.Title: HER2

Posts.Content: On 9/12/2008 cacann wrote: Hi,   In the case of breast cancer there may be too many copies of a cancer-causing gene gene called an oncogene.  This oncogene called HER2 is part of a family of genes called c-erbB-2 (otherwise known  as her-2-/neu).  I found this definition on the internet when I was diagnosised with HER2-positive breast cancer.  I have finished regular chemo and radiation treatments, and I am currently in treatments of an every three week drip of Herceptin (an antibody that targets my breast cancer).  I sent you a more involved definition, but my system shut down and was lost before I could post.  Hope this helps you.I thank you very much for this info,and will be very interested if you could send me a more involved definition, i finshed my radiation treatments about two months ago and now i'm taking aromasin.I had a pet scan which said so far all cell are clear, but this is something iwould like to discuss with my oncos.
Posts.Title: HER2

Posts.Content: Hello, I am sorry to hear that you are not feeling well.  Also thank you for the info , at  the present time I don't know if i I have Her2 or not and the onco never told me if I had this test. I'm glad that I know what to ask now. Thank GOD there is a cure for us if I did have it.  Thank you  and I hope next time we talk you are feeling  better   Sis
Posts.Title: HER2

Posts.Content: I to had alumpectomy april 08 i have had pain in my and under my with removal of 13 lymphnodes.Stange as it mite be i use lotion in these areas and it helps. I'm not into pain killers so i will try anything once.          Good luck
Posts.Title: Pain on incision area or breast????

Posts.Content: On 7/20/2008 baseballmaven wrote: Hi,   I had a lumpectomy and Sentinel Node biopsy in April, and felt like my breast and under arm had healed... I just finished chemotherapy and am starting radiation.  About a week ago I started having pain under my arm, on my side, and in my breast (which feels swollen, like just before one's period--but I'm post menopause)--it started soon after the simulation for the radiation, so I assumed it was due to the long period of time I had to lie with my arm in an uncomfortable position, but it isn't going away.   I called my surgeon who agreed that was probably the issue, as it wouldn't be post-surgical pain at this point.... but as I say, it's been over a week since the simulation... and it's not getting any better...  I don't know who to ask about this--the medical oncologist, the radiation oncologist or??? Or, am I just being dumb and it will go away on its own?  Any ideas?   Thanks so much. I had a lumpectomy about three month ago, ann i still have pain in my breast ahd under my arm which both oncossaid would happen and it would contiune even after radiation.I devolped swelling i my arm from the top of arm to my finger,and now i go to have treatment for lymphedema,so ask as many ouestions as you need to help you understand  ..good  luck,god bless.                                                                                  ...........................................................................................................goo d                                                          good                                                                .
Posts.Title: Pain 3 months post surgery, post chemo, pre radiation

Posts.Content: On 1/26/2009 lisasnfrd wrote: I had a radical mastectomy on the right side nine years ago.  Many lymph nodes were removed also and I was told to expect to get lymphadema.  I was told that if I got it, it would never end.  Well, I did get it and immediately went to a special clinic at a nearby hospital that works specifically with lymphadema.  They taught me how to massage my fingers, hand, and arm in a way that would cause the lymphatic fluid in my right arm to flow to the left side of my body, relieving the build-up of fluid, swelling, pain, etc. They said that it was possible for my body to "learn" to do this on its own without the daily massage if I kept doing the massages twice every day, morning and evening. and then wrapped my arm in ace bandages to limit the fluid building up again.  I did as they said and it worked!  The fluids rerouted and the swelling and pain went away, never to return. I haven't needed to continue the massages or wraps since then.  This therapy took about four months before the lymphadema went away.  I have other pain and fatigue from my cancer, and have found oxycontin to be the best help for that.  Good luck to you.   You made my day its good to hear that the pain and swelling end.I started with thel lymphadema whilegoing through radiation, it went away as long as iwent to clinic for thewraps and massages but now its back so its good to know it willgo away carrie
Posts.Title: Severe arm pain
